description: Coined by British chemist Humphry Davy in 1807, from potassa +‎ -ium, from Dutch potasch (“potash”).

entries.meaning: A soft, waxy, silvery reactive metal that is never found unbound in nature; an element (symbol K) with an atomic number of 19 and atomic weight of 39.0983. The symbol is derived from the Latin kalium.
(countable) A single atom of this element.
